pollaxmud.world

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • pollaxmud.world.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a World. A World consists of a list of Rooms.
    Author:
    Daniel and Oscar

    • Method Detail

      • addRoom

        public void addRoom(Room roomToAdd)
        Adds a Room to the world.
        Parameters:
        roomToAdd - Room to be added to the world.

      • putItemsRandomly

        public void putItemsRandomly(java.util.List<? extends Item> items)
        Puts given items in randomly chosen Rooms in the world.
        Parameters:
        items - List of items to add.

      • putCreaturesRandomly

        public void putCreaturesRandomly(java.util.List<? extends Creature> creatures,
                                 boolean onlyLockedRooms)
        Puts given creatures in randomly chosen Rooms in the world.
        Parameters:
        creatures - List of creatures to add.
        onlyLockedRooms - Whether the creatures should be added to locked rooms only. True means only locked rooms, false means all rooms.

      • getLockedRooms

        public java.util.List<Room> getLockedRooms()
        Get all Rooms in the world which is locked.
        Returns:
        A list of the locked Rooms in the world.

      • getNumberOfLockedRooms

        public int getNumberOfLockedRooms()
        Get the number of locked Rooms in the world.
        Returns:
        The number of locked Rooms in the world.

      • getRoomAtIndex

        public Room getRoomAtIndex(int index)
        Get the Room from the world's rooms list at a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the Room to get.
        Returns:
        The room with the given index in the worlds rooms list.

      • getRoomByName

        public Room getRoomByName(java.lang.String name)
        Get a room from the world with the same name as a given string.
        Parameters:
        name - A string which to look for a room with the same name as.
        Returns:
        The room in the world's rooms list with the same name as the given string if such room exists, else null.

      • addKeysToWorld

        public void addKeysToWorld()
        Adds keys to random positions of the world. The amount of keys to add is equal to the amount of locked rooms times 1,5.

      • getRooms

        public java.util.List<Room> getRooms()
        Getter for the World's list of rooms.
        Returns:
        A list of the Rooms in the world.
